criterion: Reward for clearly documenting the lisinopril up-titration to 40 mg orally once every morning starting the next day, matching dosage, timing, and "with or without food" wording from the visit.
Reward for recording the refill/dispensing plan (90-day supply with two refills, pharmacist swaps to larger-strength tablet, pharmacy computer cut-off explanation) exactly as described.

Reward for listing all stated warning signs and call instructions (persistent dry cough, light-headedness on standing, ankle swelling, vague "feels off," after-hours paging) without additions or omissions.

Reward for capturing lifestyle and adherence guidance: sip water to avoid dehydration potency, bring pill bottle for same-morning kidney panel, weekly email of BP log photo, 8 a.m. phone alarm, and single-dose catch-up rule.
Reward for accurate inclusion of relevant chart data (47-year-old female, essential hypertension, penicillin allergy, current lisinopril) without altering, deleting, or inventing chart elements.
Reward for overall completeness and logical structure so that every clinically pertinent statement or instruction from the encounter appears somewhere in the note.
Penalize for omitting any major medication change, monitoring instruction, side-effect warning, follow-up action, or refill detail that was explicitly stated.
Penalize for adding or inferring clinical facts, diagnoses, medications, tests, or advice not present in the transcript or chart.
Penalize for copying large, irrelevant, or outdated portions of the chart verbatim, or misreporting chart data (e.g., wrong allergy or condition).
